episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a range of quirky and fascinating topics, including the resilience of tardigrades, a bizarre crime wave of testicle theft in 1920s Chicago, the economic impact of a famous Indian tiger, and a church in Bournemouth rebranding itself to appeal to a younger audience.

facts.fact: Tardigrades can survive being shot out of a gun, but they're a bit groggy afterwards.
In the 1920s, Chicago was hit by a miniature crime wave of testicle theft, which was nicknamed 'Gland Larsony.'
Until 2016, the Indian government earned $10 million a year from a single tiger.
St. Michael's Church in Bournemouth has been renamed St. Mike's to make it seem younger and cooler.
